result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Kuduk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor Couny Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning May 1, 2017.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time. 
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case 16CM131 and any other sentence.

Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Daniel J. Kuduk in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Daniel J. Kuduk in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis. Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts,  Statement by the Attorneys.  Court orders court costs on each count; DNA sample and DNA surcharge.  The surcharge is on count 1; five days county jail on each count consecutive to each other and consecutive to 16CM131 and any other sentences. Three days sentence credit.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning May 1, 2017.  - rt

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel J. Kuduk appeared in person, in custody.  Mr. Kuduk was in court as he was arrested on new charges and the court set bond on the new charges.  The court ordered that the clerk of court begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 16CM131 and 16CM133.  - rt
Bond received from Sheriff's Department per further investigation
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. DE makes statement.  Court ordered $200.00 cash bond and $800.00 signature bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for November 8, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. ba
